title: the reason behind the usage of render_onehot_heatmap for training target instead of  render_gaussian_heatmap
body:
Hi, I would like to ask about the difference between the two kinds of heatmaps in two repositories from you.

- In the PoseFix repo, I noticed that you used [render_one_heatmap](https://github.com/mks0601/PoseFix_RELEASE/blob/master/main/model.py) for generating the training target, as shown below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2276264/105155389-d4079780-5b0a-11eb-8cc6-78e8f371a2f9.png)

- However, in another repo from you [TF-SimpleHumanPose](https://github.com/mks0601/TF-SimpleHumanPose), the gaussian heatmap [function](https://github.com/mks0601/TF-SimpleHumanPose/blob/master/main/model.py) is used for generating the training target instead, as shown below. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2276264/105156257-dd453400-5b0b-11eb-9802-afda411b15af.png)


Could you please help me clarify two things?

- Is there are paper/or description behind your `render_one_hot_heatmap` function?

- Is there any advantage of your `render_onehot_heatmap` over `render_gaussian_heatmap`  that motivated you to use it in your PoseFix repo?


Thank you for your patience and I look forward to hearing from you soon.
